problem.p: The equations below show the positions of two oscillators over time:

Which oscillator, A or B, has the greater average velocity over a full cycle? You may assume all quantities given are in S.I. units. Choose A or B. If the velocities are perfectly identical, choose "Same".

solution.p: This problem asks for the average velocity over one cycle. Since each oscillator returns to its original position at the end of a cycle, its total displacement is zero. Both oscillators (and indeed all undamped oscillators) have an average velocity of zero.
